item.title: 日本 JERA 因海外业务疲软，年度利润减半
item.description: 日本最大的发电商 JERA 表示，年度净利润减少了一半，部分原因是海外发电和可再生能源业务表现疲软。【原文：JERA, Japan's biggest power generator, said annual net profit halved, hurt in part by a weaker performance from its overseas power generation and renewable energy business.】

item.title: 被蚂蚁金服集团收购后，光大智能证券涨幅创历史新高
item.description: 蚂蚁金服集团同意以 28.1 亿港元（约合 3.6226 亿美元）的价格收购光大证券及商品集团 50.55% 的股份，该公司股价周一复牌后大涨 60.7%，创下历史新高。【原文：Shares of Bright Smart Securities & Commodities Group jumped as much as 60.7% to a record upon resumption of trading on Monday after Ant Group agreed to buy a 50.55% stake in the Hong Kong-based brokerage for HK$2.81 billion ($362.26 million).】

item.title: 新加坡为美国在药品和芯片方面的让步进行谈判
item.description: 新加坡贸易部兼副总理甘金勇（Gan Kim Yong）表示，新加坡正在就向美国出口药品的优惠政策进行谈判，同时确保其仍能从美国市场获得高端人工智能芯片。【原文：Singapore is negotiating concessions for pharmaceutical exports to the U.S. while ensuring it still has access to high-end AI chips from the American market, said Trade and Deputy Prime Minister Gan Kim Yong.】

item.title: 特朗普加征关税，中国经贸沙皇成为焦点
item.description: 上个月，全球最大的几家公司的领导人齐聚北京参加一个商业论坛，他们的主要目的是与中国领导人习近平进行梦寐以求的会面。【原文：When the leaders of some of the world's largest companies flocked to Beijing for a business forum last month, their main purpose was a coveted meeting with Chinese leader Xi Jinping.】

item.title: 丰田汽车股价有望因潜在收购而大涨
item.description: 日本汽车制造商丰田公司上周末表示，正在探讨投资收购这家关键零部件供应商的可能性，丰田工业公司的股票周一将大涨。【原文：Shares of Toyota Industries were set to surge on Monday after Japanese automaker Toyota said over the weekend it was exploring the possibility of investing in a potential buyout of the key parts supplier.】

item.title: 亚洲股市上扬；美元受制于美国的贸易奇思妙想
item.description: 周一，亚洲股市和美元走势谨慎，因为本周主要经济数据和大型科技公司财报密集发布，美国贸易政策的混乱局面几乎没有缓解的迹象。【原文：Asian share markets and the dollar made a cautious start on Monday as confusion over U.S. trade policy showed little sign of easing, in a week packed with major economic data and mega-tech earnings.】

item.title: 美元卖家暂停交易，关注美国就业情况
item.description: 美元周一开局平稳，因为投资者准备迎接本周的众多经济数据，这些数据可能会让人首次看到美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的贸易战是否打到了家门口。【原文：The dollar made a steady start on Monday as investors prepared for a week packed with economic data that may give a first glimpse of whether U.S. President Donald Trump's trade war is hitting home.】

item.title: 尽管经济前景不明朗，欧佩克+可能增加供应，但石油价格仍有所上涨
item.description: 周一早盘，油价小幅上扬，但仍受困于中美贸易谈判的不确定性，这给全球经济增长和燃料需求前景蒙上了阴影，而欧佩克+提高供应量的前景也给油价带来了更多阴霾。【原文：Oil prices inched up in early trade on Monday but remained dogged by uncertainty over trade talks between the U.S. and China clouding the outlook for global growth and fuel demand, while the prospect of OPEC+ raising its supply cast more gloom.】

item.title: 日本否认有关贝森特推动日元走强的报道
item.description: 日本最高货币外交官三村敦史（Atsushi Mimura）周一否认了《读卖新闻》（Yomiuri newspaper）的一篇报道，该报道援引美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）在华盛顿与日本财务大臣加藤胜信（Katsunobu Kato）举行双边会谈时所说的话称，弱势美元和强势日元都是可取的。【原文：Japan's top currency diplomat Atsushi Mimura on Monday denied a report in the Yomiuri newspaper that cited U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent as saying during a bilateral meeting with Japanese Finance Minister Katsunobu Kato in Washington that a weak dollar and a strong yen are desirable.】

item.title: 在詹姆斯-哈迪的反弹下，澳大利亚证券交易所运营商将重新评估并购规则
item.description: 澳大利亚证券交易所（ASX）周日表示，它已启动了有关股东批准并购的规则程序。【原文：The Australian stock exchange operator ASX said on Sunday that it had initiated a process for its rules regarding shareholder approvals for mergers & acquisitions.】

item.title: 澳大利亚林纳斯稀土公司第三季度收入增长近 22
item.description: 澳大利亚林纳斯稀土公司（Lynas Rare Earths）周一公布，受稀土产品平均售价上涨的影响，该公司第三季度收入增长了近 22%。【原文：Australia's Lynas Rare Earths on Monday posted a near 22% rise in its third-quarter revenue, helped by an uptick in the average selling price across their rare earth products.】

item.title: 贸易谈判尚未明朗，基金持稳玉米和大豆看涨押注：布劳恩
item.description: 投机者上周坚持看涨芝加哥玉米和大豆，希望美国与贸易伙伴的谈判可能取得进展，从而可能刺激美国谷物出口。【原文：Speculators held on to bullish bets in Chicago corn and soybeans last week in hopes that U.S. talks with trading partners might progress, potentially stimulating U.S. grain exports.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：中国华为开发新型人工智能芯片，欲与英伟达一较高下
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周日报道，中国华为技术公司正准备测试其最新、最强大的人工智能处理器，希望取代美国芯片巨头英伟达（Nvidia）的一些高端产品。【原文：China's Huawei Technologies is preparing to test its newest and most powerful artificial-intelligence processor, hoping to replace some higher-end products of U.S. chip giant Nvidia , the Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday.】

item.title: 中国称长江和记港口交易不得试图规避反垄断审查
item.description: 中国最高市场监管部门周日表示，正在密切关注长江和记将其大部分港口业务出售给贝莱德领导的财团的计划，交易各方不应试图逃避反垄断审查。【原文：China's top market regulator said on Sunday it was paying close attention to CK Hutchison's planned sale of most of its ports operations to a BlackRock-led consortium and parties to the deal should not try to avoid an antitrust review.】

item.title: 益普索民意调查显示，英国人对经济的信心降至至少 1978 年以来的最低点
item.description: 民调公司益普索-莫里（Ipsos MORI）周日表示，英国民众对未来 12 个月经济的信心已降至有记录以来的最低点，只有少数人预计经济会在此期间有所改善。【原文：Confidence among people in Britain about the economy over the next 12 months has fallen to the lowest on record, polling firm Ipsos MORI said on Sunday, with only a small number expecting improvement over the period.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）-世界银行会议结束，关税问题尚未明朗，但经济形势不容乐观
item.description: 过去一周，全球金融界领导人来到华盛顿，寻求澄清如何才能从唐纳德-特朗普总统的多层次关税攻击中获得一些缓解，以及这一攻击将给世界经济带来多大的痛苦。【原文：Global finance leaders came to Washington this past week seeking clarity on what it would take to get some relief from President Donald Trump's multi-layered tariff assault and on just how much pain it will bring to the world economy.】

item.title: 从橡皮鸭到 401(k)，特朗普选民感受到了关税之痛，但大多数人看到了长期收益
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普 4 月 9 日决定对中国加征关税时，佛罗里达州坦帕市的促销产品经销商 Steve Egan 正在向一家中国供应商订购 5000 只橡皮鸭。【原文：President Donald Trump’s April 9 decision to hike tariffs on China hit as Steve Egan, a promotional product distributor in Tampa, Florida, was in the middle of ordering 5,000 rubber ducks from a Chinese vendor.】

item.title: 丰田考虑投资 420 亿美元收购主要供应商
item.description: 丰田汽车公司表示，它正在探索投资收购关键零部件供应商丰田工业公司的可能性--据报道，此次收购可能耗资 420 亿美元。【原文：Toyota Motor said it is exploring the possibility of investing in a potential buyout of key parts supplier Toyota Industries - a buyout that reportedly could cost $42 billion.】

item.title: 日经新闻》报道：TikTok 将进军日本电子商务市场
item.description: 据《日经新闻》周日报道，中国社交媒体平台 TikTok 将在未来几个月内进军日本在线购物行业。【原文：Chinese social media platform TikTok will enter the online shopping industry in Japan within the next few months, Nikkei reported on Sunday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，欧洲央行对 6 月降息达成共识，但无意采取大动作
item.description: 六位消息人士告诉路透社，随着通胀持续走低，欧洲央行决策者对6月份降息越来越有信心，但几乎没有采取大动作的意愿。【原文：European Central Bank policymakers are becoming increasingly confident about cutting interest rates in June as inflation continues its march lower, but there is little to no appetite for a big move, six sources told Reuters.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，DeepMind 英国员工计划成立工会，并对与以色列有关联的交易提出质疑
item.description: 据《金融时报》周六报道，谷歌 DeepMind 在英国的员工计划成立工会，以挑战该公司将其人工智能（AI）技术出售给与以色列政府有关系的国防组织的决定。【原文：Google DeepMind staff in Britain plan to unionise to challenge the company's decision to sell its artificial intelligence (AI) technologies to defence groups with ties to the Israeli government, the Financial Times reported on Saturday.】

item.title: 文件称，倍耐力将宣布结束中国投资者对公司治理的控制
item.description: 意大利一家日报称，倍耐力董事会预计将于周一批准股东之间达成的协议，以确定该集团最大的投资者--中国国有企业中化集团--不对这家轮胎制造商行使控制权。【原文：Pirelli's board is expected to approve on Monday an accord between shareholders to establish that the group's largest investor, China's state-owned Sinochem , does not exercise control over the tyre maker, an Italian daily said.】

item.title: 韩国工业部长称将 "谨慎 "对待与美国的贸易谈判
item.description: 韩国工业部长安笃根周六表示，首尔计划 "冷静而谨慎地 "与美国进行贸易谈判。【原文：South Korea's Industry Minister Ahn Duk-geun said on Saturday that Seoul plans to approach trade talks with the United States "calmly and cautiously."】

item.title: 特朗普放过美联储和国际货币基金组织，世界松了一口气
item.description: 本周聚集在华盛顿的全球政策制定者们集体松了一口气，尽管唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）采取了内向型的做法，但过去80年来盛行的以美国为中心的经济秩序尚未崩溃。【原文：Global policymakers gathering in Washington this week breathed a collective sigh of relief that the U.S.-centric economic order that prevailed for the past 80 years was not collapsing just yet despite Donald Trump's inward-looking approach.】

item.title: 日本任天堂粉丝在关税忧虑中测试 Switch 2 上市前的性能
item.description: 任天堂的粉丝们周六在东京附近的一个活动上有机会试用了该公司的新游戏设备 Switch 2。【原文：Nintendo fans were given a chance to try out the company's new Switch 2 gaming device at an event near Tokyo on Saturday, ahead of a release that some worry could be overshadowed by tariffs driving up prices.】

item.title: 乌克兰部分电子支付系统中断
item.description: 据乌克兰官员和路透社的目击者称，乌克兰邮局、餐馆和地铁系统的电子支付系统在周六早些时候已经失灵。【原文：Electronic payments systems in post offices, restaurants and the metro system were out of action in Ukraine early on Saturday, according to officials and Reuters witnesses.】

item.title: 在美国的竞争中，中国国家主席习近平呼吁自给自足地发展人工智能
item.description: 据中国国家媒体周六报道，中国国家主席习近平承诺 "自力更生、自强不息"，在中国发展人工智能，因为中国正与美国争夺人工智能这一关键战略领域的霸主地位。【原文：China's President Xi Jinping pledged "self-reliance and self-strengthening" to develop AI in China, state media reported on Saturday, as the country vies with the U.S. for supremacy in artificial intelligence, a key strategic area.】

item.title: 日产将终止武汉工厂的汽车生产-读卖新闻
item.description: 读卖新闻》援引未透露姓名的消息来源报道称，日产汽车将在截至 2026 年 3 月 31 日的本营业年度内停止在中国武汉工厂的汽车生产。【原文：Nissan Motor will end vehicle production at its Wuhan plant in China during the current business year which ends March 31, 2026, the Yomiuri newspaper reported citing sources it did not identify.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，埃隆-马斯克的 XAI 控股公司正在洽谈向投资者融资 200 亿美元事宜
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周五援引知情人士的话报道，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的XAI控股公司正在与投资者谈判，为其新合并的人工智能初创公司和社交媒体业务筹集约200亿美元资金。【原文：Elon Musk's XAI Holdings is in talks with investors to raise roughly $20 billion in funding for his newly combined artificial intelligence startup and social media business, Bloomberg News reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 联合利华称未要求 Ben & Jerry's 首席执行官下台，敦促驳回诉讼
item.description: 联合利华（Unilever）周五驳斥了其试图以支持公司的进步社会活动为由赶走 Ben & Jerry's 前首席执行官戴夫-斯蒂弗（Dave Stever）的说法，称联合利华为他提供了更大的职位和更高的薪酬，但他选择了辞职。【原文：Unilever on Friday rejected the claim it tried to oust former Ben & Jerry's chief executive Dave Stever for supporting his company's progressive social activism, saying it offered him a bigger role and more pay but he chose to resign.】
